intro: Corydalis clavibracteata, commonly known as the narrow-bracted corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a creeping or ascending growth habit. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade, making it a suitable candidate for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value lies in its intricate flower structure and ability to bloom throughout the spring and early summer.
